result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah T Ruffins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for early termination at 30 mo with agent approval.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and jail diversion. Stayed and can be used at agent discretion.

charges.descr: Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM Defendant Isaiah T Ruffins in court with Attorney Guy Cardamone and Attorney Tracey J. Lencioni.  ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

Statement by defendants mother, E.W. Statement by ADA Verhoff. Statement by Attorney Lencioni. Statement by defendant.

COUNT #1   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 5 years. Eligible for early termination at 30 months with agent approval. 

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 6 months in the Dane County Jail, w/huber and jail diversion. Stayed and can be used at agent discretion 
-Maintain full-time employment/education or a combination of both or be seeking same and treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Defendant not to use or possess any weapon 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation.

-Days credit for time already served: 5 days credit
-Days credit if revoked: 5 days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent electronically to DOC
of support - defn
Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the state. Attorney Tracey J. Lencioni appeared in person with Defn. Plea/Sent scheduled, NIH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $10,000 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)] or facsimile weapon. 
- Defendant shall not have any firearms within their residence. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 11:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. except only as necessary for purposes of employment. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
